revised_title: Characterization of Antibodies to P-Bungarotoxin and its Phospholipase Inactive Derivative
tldr: The authors raised antisera against the presynaptic neurotoxin P-bungarotoxin and its phospholipase inactive derivative. They examined the cross-reactivity of the antisera with other phospholipase A2 enzymes and polypeptide neurotoxins. The antisera inhibited both the neurotoxic effects of P-bungarotoxin at the frog motor endplate and the enzymatic activity of the toxin on model phospholipid membranes. This study provides insights into the molecular mechanisms of P-bungarotoxin's neuromuscular action and the role of enzyme activity in this action.
